topic.title: Tried to write a new blogging platform for ZeroNet
topic.body:
Hello everyone. I stumbled upon ZeroNet a couple of weeks ago and I started writing a blogging platform trying to understand how it works.

Anyway, I 've ended up with more questions than answers, but stabilizing the platform with stick and glue, I have come to a first crude result.

If you want to check it out, you can find it here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JrT4VnMgpm6GgHV6R9yvgp5WkY8yTnRr7

I intend to work more on it and add some more features, the lack of which at the moment is obvious.

Would like to hear some thoughts

Thank you

topic.title: ZeroPress version 0.3
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JrT4VnMgpm6GgHV6R9yvgp5WkY8yTnRr7/

This version comes with the ability to add images inside your posts. It is still in a primitive stage, so after insertion you will have to drag and drop it at the point of your document you want it to exist. The feature where it will be placed right where you type, will be implemented in a later version. Not the next one.


It also comes with some minor upgrades to the code which from now on will also be available on github. ZeroNet GitCenter will be next.

https://github.com/cleancodetech/ZeroPress

topic.title: ZeroPress version 0.4
topic.body:
Hello all.

I made some further modifications to a blogging platform I try to write for ZeroNet on my free time:

Added an assets panel in the admin section, where users can manage their uploaded images. Using the interface, one can also find unused images, meaning images that are not used in some way either on posts or on the site in general and they can delete them.
Also the Social Menus were moved to their own panel and reddit is also made available.
Some changes to the theme as well, trying to tackle the problem where an admin would create a new post but it would not appear on the front side.
Also added a viewport entry on the content.json file. Props to styromaniac@kxoid.bit

You can find it here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JrT4VnMgpm6GgHV6R9yvgp5WkY8yTnRr7

Any feedback would be appreciated. Thank you for your time :)

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_839_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): @gtat314Post modification is not reflected on the front endi clonned your blog and editted the default blog post, but on the homepage i still see the blog post "ZeroPress version 0.3", its text is "version 0.3May 19th 2019This version comes with the ability"...When i click "Read more" it redirect me to "/post.html?id=48". When i try to edit it via /admin/editPost.html?id=48 , i see my modified post, but on the site front end, it shows not modified default post text and title. [...]

Hello. Thank you for your feedback.

This is not a ZeroPress problem. This is how ZeroNet works. Your changes will not be visible to the public, until you have seeders for your site. If your new post is visible in the admin panel but not in public view, then your new post will appear to all visitors of your site, regardless if you do not see it at the moment. Try restarting ZeroNet. This usually make the changes visible to you as well. The same goes for edited posts. Changes will not be visible to public view, until you have seeders to your site, or you restart ZeroNet.

I am writing a guide at the moment, and probably tomorrow there will be a better explanation at the moment.

PS: Yes, the image will not be deleted. For the time, you 'll have to remove it manually. The deletion of images not in use, is an upcoming feature
